prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a rectangle with four lines in the sketch: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.5945] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.5945], End Point [0.0, 0.5945] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5945], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 6. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.2575 units - Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0 units - Sketch scale: 0.75 - Operation: Create a new solid body Part 2: Cylindrical object Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom. The height of the cylinder is approximately three times its diameter. The object is symmetrical along its central axis. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.2393, 0.1813, 0.2575] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a circle with the following properties: - Center: [0.1418, 0.1418] - Radius: 0.1418 units 4. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.2837. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 6. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.2575 units - Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0 units - Sketch scale: 0.2837 - Operation: Join or add material to the preceding CAD model</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.5945]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.5945],"End Point":[0.0,0.5945]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.5945],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.2575,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.2393,0.1813,0.2575]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.1418,0.1418],"Radius":0.1418}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.2575,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.2837,"operation":"JoinFeatureOperation"}}}}

prompt: <description>Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 1 unit in height. The sloped side is at a 45 degree angle. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with an euler angle of [0, 0, 0] and a translation vector of [0, 0, 0]. Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of one face. On this face, draw a series of 9 lines as follows: * Line 1: [0, 0] to [0.1134, 0] * Line 2: [0.1134, 0] to [0.1134, 0.252] * Line 3: [0.1134, 0.252] to [0.189, 0.252] * Line 4: [0.189, 0.252] to [0.189, 0] * Line 5: [0.189, 0] to [0.3024, 0] * Line 6: [0.3024, 0] to [0.3024, 0.5402] * Line 7: [0.3024, 0.5402] to [0.3024, 0.5484] * Line 8: [0.3024, 0.5484] to [0, 0.5484] * Line 9: [0, 0.5484] to [0, 0] Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.5484. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles of [0, 0, 45] (representing a 45 degree rotation about the Z axis) and a translation vector of [0, 0, 0]. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate a 3D solid model with an extrusion depth of 0.2016 towards the normal, and no extrusion in the opposite direction of the normal. Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a metallic tube. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with an euler angle of [180, 0, -90] and a translation vector of [0.2016, 0.5484, 0.0504]. Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of one face. On this face, draw a circle with a center at [0.0504, 0.0504] and a radius of 0.0504. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.1008. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles of [0, 0, 0] and a translation vector of [0, 0, 0]. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate a 3D solid model with an extrusion depth of 0.1008 towards the normal, and no extrusion in the opposite direction of the normal. Using a "JoinFeatureOperation", combine the two 3D solid bodies to form a final 3D model resembling a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center, where the height, width, and length of the prism are 1.0, 0.5484, and 2.0 units, respectively, and the hole is a cylinder of radius 0.0504, with a length of 0.1008 and a height of 0.1008. Position the final shape at a slight angle to the viewer.</description>
